forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 1pm. Mostly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West wind 13 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the clock nudges past noon, Downtown San Francisco stands at a crossroads between the lingering whispers of rain and the promise of clearer skies. The day, while cloaked in a gentle chill, reveals a mostly sunny disposition as the sun pushes through sporadic clouds, illuminating the cityscape with a subdued glow. Those strolling through the streets might sense faint traces of moisture in the air—an echo of the overnight drizzle, with a chance of light rain still lingering until early afternoon.

Tonight, the city will settle into a tranquil calm, as temperatures dip into the pleasant embrace of the mid-forties. Gentle winds whisper through the streets, carrying the freshness of the day into the night. The west-northwest currents, while mild, should be taken into account when choosing one’s attire; a light jacket or sweater will suffice, perhaps paired with a scarf for extra comfort. This weather invites simple joys—an afternoon walk along the Embarcadero, where the clear views of the bay can inspire quiet reflection, or a leisurely coffee at a cozy café, watching the ebb and flow of city life. With the fading light and the promise of a cooler evening, the city beckons one to enjoy its refined charm before the night descends.
